title: Teamfight Tactics - Gold does not compensate not getting items
body:
No one in this TfT should ever feel at disadvantage for not having an item. If you don't get a single item by the first 2 rounds there should be a clause  you get experience+ gold. If I wont get items to buff my heroes than give me more heroes. 

When I see people with 3/4 completed items before wolves and I have a single item drop (not including the draft item) it tends to put me on tilt. Because an assassin, blademaster, RFC level 2 lucian is not exactly easy to deal with when I have a giants belt on vayne and a tear on my garen

replies.body: "Oh look, I got 7 gold!  That will definitely help me defeat that double rageblade vayne they have....."

> [{quoted}](name=Porglit,realm=NA,application-id=RaE1aOE7,discussion-id=z4tkx81I,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-07-26T23:31:54.100+0000)
>
> "Oh look, I got 7 gold!  That will definitely help me defeat that double rageblade vayne they have....."

I'd be more scared of a lvl 1 Lulu with double rageblade than a 3 star Vayne.

I got lucky the other day and got Kayle with double spear and rapidfire. 

That was scary.

I see your double spear+RFC Kayle and raise you a Titanic Hydra+Statikk Shiv+IE Yasuo.
Before wolves.
That was hilarious.
For me.
honestly, im fine if i get the 6 gold drop from creeps. but the 1 and 2 gold? fuck off with that shit.

Double rageblade Vayne? Rageblade is not very good and I'd be grinning ear to ear if they stacked Rageblades on Vayne.

Now double morellos Kennen? That's something terrifying.

What? Rageblade _is_ very good, no question about it - unless your team is so powerful you can basically oneshot everyone. But you're right that Vayne is not the proper carry for a rageblade, you want it on a Draven, or a bear, or a Kassadin.

I also wouldn't equip double morellos, because the healing negation only applies once. Morello+Gunblade, now _that_ is a scary Kennen, because he won't die while ulting.
Just saying without items after 2 to 3 rounds just leave the game because you're not catching up at all.

Nah. No items? That's permission to go for the cheap combos. Grab a Lissandra and a Braum, and go full glacials - doesn't matter if your units are bronze, just maximize the cheapness. You won't get first place, but even if you can never silver anything you won't die too fast, and you can probably make it to 5th even with terrible luck. That's a lot of difference with being last.
Free opportunity of LP for everyone else.
I mean maybe just maybe if you got like 10 gold.
Remove all item drops and make them purchase able

Yes this. It makes it more about tactics because you can actually put more planning into your draft. They should make items purchasable but with a max of 1 component per wave or something so people dont just run like 3 gold champs with 9 items in the early, or even make it every other wave. For example starting an assasian comp only to end up with 2 negatron cloaks a tear and a chain vest and you just sit there like WTF do i do with this now. IMO it should be more about HOW you plan out and play the game than a lucky gamble on items.
definitely the current system makes it hard to plan. i literally have to look up item build sheet on google just so i know how to build certain items during a match.

i agree it really put you at a disadvantage. i've seen people by round 2 or 3 have like 3 or 2 have items on one assassin pyke and 2 items on another champ like lucien. its like how the hell did you get those items so fast.

Then they get 3 gold off Krugs and 1 item off wolves.

The game has drop protection, if they're loaded with items and you got nothing, they'll get nothing later and you'll get the drops.
they really do need to balance it more considering its based off items and economy
They are, they're nerfing player damage so you can econ safer if you have bad luck early, meaning you're in a healthier position when you get to the creep round when your drop protection kicks in.
Are they actually nerfing player damage or are they gonna pull a fast one on us like they did with items?
yes, they are actually nerfing it.
well thats good. lets hope next patch they'll have some good updates for TFT

I feel like this is how the game is suppose to be, one person just gets shafted by "RNG" when it really is a seed that generates the worst drafts possible. Not getting a single level 2 champion until draft phase 2. Like even if it was possible to buy every single champ in the pool I would STILL not be able to create a level 2.

It just seems like such a short-sighted, weird solution -- a bandaid that would make everyone forget about how horrible it feels to get 0 items and someone else gets 4. 
"Here, have some pennies and shut up, you ungrateful peasants."

Do they have just anyone with **logic** working on this problem? Substitutes really only work if the substitute good (x) has a perceived value of equality to good (y), in this case: if the value of the gold (x) you get is equal to the value of the items you _would_ get (y). Currently, this is damn near impossible to estimate when the type of items that drop are also RNG and the **VALUE** of the items are highly varied, usually dependent on team comps and champs you buy. 

So, how could the gold substitute become equal in value to items? Well, Riot could _try_ to do EXTENSIVE calculations regarding the gold-value of each item on each champion in every team comp, and cross-reference that with what players in your game are building to determine the gold you should get from Creep rounds when you get don't get items. (not the right solution)

OR you could create a shop for players to BUY items from the gold they get. (not a bad solution imo)

OR you could just remove the RNG element from # of item drops by giving everyone the same # of item drops, consequently removing the need for inadequate gold compensation. 

But that's just my two cents. {{item:3634}}
Injecting extra gold into the early game is what has led to this fast punishing meta. Everyone is pushing levels faster and higher quality boards are showing up far faster then before.

Early gold is very valuable HOWEVER it cannot make up for items at all because items are busted in this game and scale insanely late game, you might get a boost early game with this new system but you know you are wasting time and will get smashed late game anyway. I dont understand why the devs wanna be children about this, they refused to listen and implemented this new "have some gold and shut up" system and nobody is impressed.

What items you get already provides TONS of rng, you dont need more rng that straight up makes you much weaker in the long run.

Give.

Everybody.

The.

Same.

Number.

Of.

Items.

Or winning will always be heavily rng influenced from the very start.

See, I think they just need to make sure you *always* get 4 gold from what should've been an item drop. 4 gold is enough to make a substantial difference, and you can accelerate yourself further ahead in the game than the guy with all the items through economy/loss-streaking until suddenly you have a shitload of level 3s and strong ass comps far before you should.

There's a point where gold can equal out to an item, but 1 or 2 wont cut it.

you should get one item warranty from each PVE round, that will balance the game around items, problem is some items are so situational while others are a requirement for a comp. wanna run ranger/gunslingers? get those bows boys
